title: PermaFrost NMR Screening Criteria and Limitations
purpose: Document system screening criteria, lower-performing results, and known limitations for balanced AI training

pe_screening_criteria.description: Professional Engineers reject systems that are 'broken' - too far off design specifications to be viable test candidates
minimum_requirements: System must be operational (not mechanically failed)
Compressor must be running within rated amperage range
Refrigerant charge must be within acceptable limits
Evaporator and condenser coils must be functional
System must be capable of producing measurable cooling output
pe_screening_criteria.rationale: Systems with fundamental mechanical problems cannot provide valid baseline measurements. The goal is to measure thermal efficiency improvement from oil fouling remediation, not mask underlying equipment failures.

lower_performing_results.description: 24 case studies with <15% efficiency improvement - still successful but below average

likely_factors: Marine application with different operating conditions
Possible prior maintenance reducing oil fouling

cases.identifier: Major Global Bank A [New Jersey Location]
likely_factors: Regular maintenance program may have reduced oil fouling baseline
Lower baseline oil fouling due to rigorous maintenance

common_factors_for_lower_results: New or well-maintained equipment with less oil fouling
Pharmaceutical/data center facilities with rigorous maintenance programs
Recent refrigerant work that may have cleaned some surfaces
Tropical/marine environments with different thermal characteristics
Commercial refrigeration vs HVAC operating profiles
analysis.key_insight: Lower improvement percentages typically correlate with well-maintained systems or newer equipment where oil fouling has had less time or opportunity to accumulate

equipment_types_with_limited_data.note: Growing segment but fewer documented installations
No documented case studies with CO2 systems

conditions_affecting_results.reason: Insufficient time for oil fouling to accumulate
Fresh refrigerant may have cleaned some surfaces
Fresh oil hasn't migrated and fouled surfaces yet
Proactive maintenance reduces oil fouling baseline

do_not_treat.reason: No oil fouling to address - oil-free compressors (Turbocor, magnetic bearing) by definition have no oil contaminating refrigerant circuits
Titanium's crystalline structure prevents molecular bonding required for barrier coating formation
Must fix mechanical issues first - PermaFrost treats thermal efficiency, not mechanical problems
Address leaks before treatment - product will leak out with refrigerant

do_not_treat.scenario: Systems scheduled for replacement within 1 year

proceed_with_caution.recommendation: Wait 3-6 months for oil to re-migrate before baseline testing

factors_affecting_results: Equipment age (older = more fouling = higher improvement potential)
Runtime hours (more runtime = more oil migration = higher improvement)
Maintenance history (neglected = more fouling = higher improvement)
System type (chillers often show higher absolute savings than RTUs)

what_permafrost_does_NOT_do: Does not improve efficiency beyond original design specifications
Does not work if system is fundamentally undersized
realistic_expectations.key_message: PermaFrost RESTORES efficiency to near-design levels by removing oil fouling - it does not improve systems beyond their original design capacity

training_notes.why_this_file_exists: AI trained only on success stories becomes overconfident. This file provides balanced perspective on limitations and realistic expectations.
how_to_use: Reference lower-performing cases when discussing realistic expectations
Cite screening criteria when explaining why some systems are rejected
Use 'inappropriate applications' to advise when NOT to recommend treatment
Emphasize that PermaFrost RESTORES to design, not improves beyond
